translation.en: [Dr. Jacques Bailly] ] Champion spellers, we are now in uncharted territory.
translation.ko: 챔피언 스펠러 여러분 이제 미지의 영역입니다

translation.en: We're throwing the dictionary at you
and so far you are showing this dictionary who is boss.
We've now reached the start of round 20,
the round I informed you would be the final one of this competition.
translation.ko: 우리는 이 라운드로 최후의 승자를 가려낼 겁니다

translation.en: When we get to the end of round 20,
we will take an extraordinary step of declaring as co-champions
those of you still remaining in the competition.
translation.ko: 공동 우승이라는 놀라운 영예를 안을 것입니다

translation.en: -[pronouncer] You are correct! -[audience cheering]
-[pronouncer] You are correct! -[audience cheering]
[pronouncer] You are correct!
You are correct.
-You are correct. -[audience cheering]
Correct.
Correct.
You are correct.
[male host 1] It's complete.
You're all champions of the 2019 Scripps National Spelling Bee.
translation.ko: 스크립스 스펠링 비 전국 대회의 2019년 챔피언들입니다

translation.en: [male host 1] They will forever be remembered as the Elite 8,
the eight spellers that for three and a half hours
took the best parts the dictionary had to throw at them,
and this is the night that the kids won the Spelling Bee.
translation.ko: 오늘 밤 스펠링 비 챔피언은 바로 이들입니다

translation.en: And there you have it,
a picture that will be on the front page of every newspaper and website.
[male] Spelling bees are a time-honored American tradition
and the Scripps National Spelling Bee
is the most prestigious contest in the country.
translation.ko: 미국 내에서 가장 권위 있는 대회죠

translation.en: [female] South Asian-American kids are dominating the Scripps National Spelling Bee.
translation.ko: 남아시아계 미국인 어린이들이 스펠링 비 전국 대회를 장악합니다

translation.en: I think people are curious about, like, do they have a secret?
Is there something that they’re genetically predisposed to knowing?
The most phenomenal assemblage of super spellers.
Meet the kids who exhausted the dictionary itself.
translation.ko: 사전을 나가떨어지게 한 어린이들을 만나 보시죠

translation.en: -The Octo-Champs, ladies and gentlemen! -[audience cheering, applauding]
What kind of a name is Erin?
Since 2008, a decade of dominance.
[Hari Kondabolu] We rival the Yankees, the Dallas Cowboys, Celtics, Lakers.
translation.ko: 양키스, 댈러스 카우보이스 셀틱스, 레이커스가 있다면

translation.en: Indian-American kids in spelling, like, we’re in that.
translation.ko: 인도계 미국인 아이들은 스펠링을 유독 잘해요

translation.en: When we find something that works, we go all in.
[male] Something clearly is going on that needs to be better understood.
translation.ko: 확실히 이해하고 넘어가야 하는 뭔가가 있는 게 분명해요

translation.en: ...international society of people with high IQs has two new members.
translation.ko: 고지능자 국제 모임에 신입 회원 2명이 들어왔습니다

translation.en: They're children!
Three-year-old Akash Vukoti and five-year-old Amritha Vukoti
have been accepted into the American MENSA.
translation.ko: 미국 멘사에 가입했습니다 "아카슈 부코티 멘사 회원"

translation.en: Welcome to Little Big Shots!
You have never seen kids like the ones who are coming out here today.
translation.ko: 오늘 주인공 같은 어린이들은 처음 보실 겁니다

translation.en: [Steve Harvey] Cona-sewer.
[laughing] No! Not "cona-sewer."
-Okay, catch it up. -[audience laughing]
The kids getting the big buzz at the Spelling Bee.
translation.ko: 이 아이는 스펠링 비에서 엄청난 주목을 받았습니다

translation.en: A six-year-old making history
as the first first-grader ever in the competition.
Inviscate.
-Inviscate. -[female] That is correct.
Well, funny story. First, my uncle... One of my uncles...
translation.ko: 재밌는 이야기가 있어요 제 삼촌 한 분이 "아카슈, 7세 2세부터 스펠링 시작"

translation.en: was feeding me something like a type of rice thingy.
And then he showed a spoon, told me to spell "spoon."
translation.ko: 숟가락을 보여 주며 '스푼' 스펠링을 알려 주신 거예요

translation.en: I said...
So the next day, the same uncle came to me and said to spell "spoon" again.
translation.ko: 다음 날, 같은 삼촌이 또 와서 '스푼' 스펠링을 또 알려 줬어요

translation.en: I spelled...
That was not normal for, you know, for a two... just two-years-old kid
translation.ko: 두 살짜리 꼬마한테는 흔한 일이 아니었어요

translation.en: to spell it back in the same sequence, in the same order of the alphabet.
translation.ko: 같은 순서로 단어 스펠링을 대다니 놀라웠죠

translation.en: That was the first time when we noticed that, oh, he...
He has something into the spellings.
That’s when my parents saw that first interest.
translation.ko: 그때 부모님이 제 첫 관심사를 알아봐 주셨어요

translation.en: First interest.
-[Mom] Who are the Spelling Bee champion? -I am!
I am the Spelling Bee champion.
-What's "L" for? -Lion!
-What’s "lion" spelling? -Lion? L-I-O-N. Lion!
[Krishna] I came from a rural village in India.
translation.ko: 전 인도 시골 마을 출신이에요 "아카슈의 부모는 안드라프라데시 출신이다"

translation.en: If I didn’t dream high, I wouldn’t be coming to America.
translation.ko: 큰 포부가 없었다면 미국에도 안 왔을 겁니다

translation.en: A kid who was born here in America should do a lot more.
translation.ko: 미국에서 태어난 아이는 더 많은 걸 해야 하잖아요 "아카슈는 메릴랜드 록빌에서 태어났다"

translation.en: The goal for Akash would be to be a good citizen.
translation.ko: 아카슈의 목표는 좋은 시민이 되는 겁니다

translation.en: So whatever he does, whatever he learns, it should benefit the community,
translation.ko: 무엇을 하고 배우든 이 사회에 도움이 되어야죠

translation.en: the country, the world.
Something like, you know, Microsoft, for example.
Or the Google, or the Facebook! Should be something like that,
that should change the lives of the people around the world.
translation.ko: 세상 사람들의 삶을 바꿀 수 있는 일요

translation.en: We don’t know.... I mean, if it happens, we’ll be really blessed.
translation.ko: 혹시 모르죠 그렇게만 된다면 축복일 겁니다

translation.en: One of the myths, I think, that people have about Indian-Americans
translation.ko: 인도계 미국인의 성공에 대한 오해 중 하나는

translation.en: and their success is that it's somehow genetic or even ethnic.
translation.ko: 그것이 유전이나 인종과 관련 있다는 겁니다

translation.en: So what happened in the United States?
The Indians who do well in Spelling Bees in America
translation.ko: 미국 스펠링 비에서 활약하는 인도계 미국인들은

translation.en: are drawn from Indians who were very adventurous,
translation.ko: 매우 모험적인 자질을 지닌 인도인들의 후손입니다

translation.en: who decided to take advantage
of the relaxation of American immigration rules in 1965.
translation.ko: 그 기회를 노리고 바다를 건넌 이들이죠

translation.en: [Lyndon B. Johnson] This bill says simply that from this day forth,
those wishing to immigrate to America
shall be admitted on the basis of their skills
translation.ko: 그들이 가진 기술과 미국 내 가까운 혈연을 바탕으로

translation.en: and their close relationships to those already here.
This is a simple test, and it is a fair test.
Those who can contribute most to this country,
translation.ko: 이 나라에 가장 큰 기여를 하는 자

translation.en: to its growth, to its strength, to its spirit,
translation.ko: 이 나라의 성장과 힘, 정신에 가장 크게 이바지하는 자가

translation.en: will be the first that are admitted to this land.
That stopped the relatively racist quotas on who could immigrate from where
translation.ko: 이민자의 출신에 따른 인종 차별적 쿼터가 "파완 딩그라, 사회학자 & 작가 애머스트 칼리지"

translation.en: in other parts of the world,
and it allowed for immigrants to come in
from Asia, Africa, the Caribbean...
Parts of the world that had been oftentimes cut off.
translation.ko: 배제되기 일쑤였던 곳곳의 사람들에게 문이 열렸어요

translation.en: It wasn’t like every South Asian was allowed in.
They picked people who were the most educated,
translation.ko: 교육 수준이 가장 높은 사람들만 선택받았죠 "하리 콘다볼루 코미디언"

translation.en: who could add a very clear, like, monetary value,
and serve a clear purpose for America and its economy.
[Fareed Zakaria] And Indians take advantage of this, but mostly, they are engineers, doctors.
translation.ko: 모든 인도인에게 기회가 열렸지만 대부분은 엔지니어, 의사였어요

translation.en: One of the interesting things to notice is how many Indian doctors you’ll find
in very remote parts of America.
And you see them in rural Alabama or Mississippi or Louisiana,
translation.ko: 앨라배마나 미시시피 루이지애나 시골 마을 등지에요

translation.en: and you ask yourself, "Why was there an Indian doctor in one of these places?"
translation.ko: 왜 그런 곳에 인도계 의사가 있나 궁금하셨겠죠

translation.en: 'Cause no white person wanted to go to rural Alabama and be a doctor,
translation.ko: 백인 의사는 그 시골을 선호하지 않았거든요

translation.en: and those were the job openings that the Indians filled.
translation.ko: 그 때문에 생긴 일자리를 인도계가 채운 겁니다

translation.en: [Pawan Dhingra] Then in the '80s, and really mushrooming in the '90s
and since then, has been the growth of the IT industry.
translation.ko: IT 산업 또한 이민자들에게 문을 열어 주었죠

translation.en: There wasn’t conflict.
There wasn’t persecution or prosecution.
They weren’t fleeing. It was all really revolved around possibility.
So I don’t think it’s this magical Indian cultural superiority stuff
translation.ko: 흔히들 이야기하는 인도 문화권의 우월성 같은 건

translation.en: I hear all the time.
A portion of the story is culture,
but a large portion is how people got here.
translation.ko: 그들이 이민해 온 과정이 큰 역할을 차지하죠

translation.en: In addition to, like, you know, India’s a colonized country.
English was around.
[Fareed] They come to the United States.
They get trained or they go to companies. They do well.
translation.ko: 훈련을 받고 회사에 갔습니다 훌륭하게 제 몫을 해냈죠

translation.en: Now, they have children,
and they want to ensure that their children
take advantage of these extraordinary opportunities
that they see in America as immigrants.
[Dr. Balu Natarajan] My parents came for opportunity.
translation.ko: 제 부모님은 기회를 위해 이곳에 오셨어요

translation.en: There was a lot of emphasis on language growing up inside the house,
and English was extremely stressed.
I think a lot of my interest in spelling
translation.ko: 제가 스펠링에 관심을 갖게 된 건

translation.en: came because of that early exposure to English through my mom
translation.ko: 어머니를 통해 영어에 빨리 노출됐기 때문이라고 봐요 "미국 최고의 슈퍼 스펠러"

translation.en: and somewhat my dad.
It took a solid four years for me to get from start to finish
in my National Spelling Bee win pursuit,
translation.ko: 처음부터 끝까지 총 4년이라는 세월이 걸렸어요 스펠링 비 전국 대회 우승을 위해 그 많은 시간을 투자한 후에야

translation.en: and then eventually, in 1985, I was able to win.
[male] It was his third try at the National Spelling Bee.
translation.ko: 스펠링 비 전국 대회에 세 번째 도전한 끝에

translation.en: Third time’s the charm!
For him this year, no bell will bing.
translation.ko: 올해는 단 한 번의 오답도 없었군요

translation.en: [Dr. Balu] I don’t think I recognized the magnitude of that
translation.ko: 그게 얼마나 큰일이었는지는 수십 년이 지난 후에 알았어요

translation.en: probably until decades later.
translation.ko: 그게 얼마나 큰일이었는지는 수십 년이 지난 후에 알았어요 그땐 미처 몰랐죠

translation.en: And when I realized
how relevant it was that the son of immigrants
translation.ko: 이민자 아들의 스펠링 비 전국 대회 우승은

translation.en: had won the National Spelling Bee
translation.ko: 스펠링 비 전국 대회 우승은 다른 이민자들 특히 인도계 부모들을 자극했고

translation.en: was when I saw other immigrants, primarily Indian parents,
translation.ko: 다른 이민자들 특히 인도계 부모들을 자극했고

translation.en: um, say that it was 1985
that put the National Spelling Bee on the map for Indians.
translation.ko: 그래서인지 1985년 이후로 많은 인도계 학생이 스펠링 비에 참가하게 됐어요

translation.en: And so while I never pretended that it was a big deal
translation.ko: 대단한 일을 해낸 양 뽐낸 적은 없지만 "스펠링 비 승리 일생의 주문을 걸다"

translation.en: other people informed me that it was a big deal to them.
translation.ko: 그걸 대단하게 본 사람들도 분명히 있었습니다

translation.en: [Shourav] Playing tennis and spelling are pretty similar
because it takes persistence,
because the first time you go to a match or a spelling bee, you might not win.
translation.ko: 첫 경기나 첫 스펠링 비에서는 이기기가 힘들어요

translation.en: Because the more you practice, the better you get,
translation.ko: 연습을 많이 할수록 실력이 더 좋아지고

translation.en: and then you can just get better and better.
translation.ko: 그래야 더 잘할 수 있어요 그러다 결국에

translation.en: And then eventually, you just...
translation.ko: 그러다 결국에 모든 상황이 맞아떨어지면 우승할 기회가 생기기도 하죠

translation.en: Everything will fall into place and maybe you’ll win.
translation.ko: 모든 상황이 맞아떨어지면 우승할 기회가 생기기도 하죠

translation.en: Well, I’ve been doing this for many years.
translation.ko: 전 여러 해 동안 대회를 준비했어요

translation.en: I started when I was in second grade, and every year I’ve constantly improved,
translation.ko: 2학년부터 시작해서 매년... 꾸준히 발전했죠 부디 올해는 우승하고 싶어요

translation.en: so, like, hopefully that this year will be the year.
translation.ko: 꾸준히 발전했죠 부디 올해는 우승하고 싶어요

translation.en: [Usha] We are originally from India.
translation.ko: 우리는 원래 인도 출신이에요 인도에는 언어가 많아서 다들 이중 언어에 익숙한 터라

translation.en: India has lots of languages, so I think that bilingual concept
translation.ko: 인도에는 언어가 많아서 다들 이중 언어에 익숙한 터라 다른 언어를 배우는 데 도움이 되지 않았나 싶어요

translation.en: helped them learn a lot of other languages too.
translation.ko: 다른 언어를 배우는 데 도움이 되지 않았나 싶어요

translation.en: There is an expectation that he’ll do well and probably win.
translation.ko: 쇼라브는 잘할 거고 우승 가능성도 있다고 봅니다 "우샤 & 가네슈 쇼라브의 부모"

translation.en: Um, but also I think he’s kind of used to the pressure,
and also it’s not like a random guess.
He has proven himself that he could win the other competitions.
So that gives him the confidence.
I think he doesn’t feel that pressure so much.
translation.ko: 그다지 부담을 느끼지도 않는 것 같아요

translation.en: [male] How good is he, really?
He's really good. [stammers] Um...
I mean, when I was...
translation.ko: 그러니까 제가... 제가 8학년일 때는 우리 둘이 비슷비슷했는데

translation.en: When I was still in eighth grade, I would say we were about equal,
but, like, since then, he’s kept on going.
I wanna say he is probably the best speller in the world.
-He's like Michael Jordan. -Obviously, Michael Jordan. Yeah.
translation.ko: - 꼭 마이클 조던 같아요 - 맞아요, 마이클 조던 마이클 조던은 언제나 최고의 선수잖아요

translation.en: Michael Jordan is just, like, consistently the best player in,
like, in the league when he was playing,
and I think Shourav is, like, consistently the best speller in the school,
translation.ko: 쇼라브는 우리 학교에서 언제나 최고로 잘하는 스펠러예요

translation.en: and probably, like, in the state,
and, like, maybe, probably even the nation.
translation.ko: 우리 주에서도 1등 우리 나라에서도 1등일지 모르죠 "매사추세츠 노스앤도버"

translation.en: [girl] We found a word that Ashrita did not know!
[Ashrita] S-U-P-E-R-C...
...you have all day!
By the time she was two, two and a half, she was already good at solving puzzles,
translation.ko: 딸은 두 살 반쯤부터 퍼즐을 잘 맞췄고

translation.en: and she was asking for more,
and she was able to recognize some of the letters.
And by the time she was three, she was able to read the smaller books,
translation.ko: 세 살쯤 되자 쉬운 책을 읽기 시작했어요

translation.en: the books with a few words in each sentence.
So we did not think of it as a talent.
We thought it was a normal thing -that all kids do... -For all kids!
...and so we just continued filling her with more and more,
whatever she was comfortable with.
Basically, it started a really long time ago when I was about five.
translation.ko: 시작한 지는 오래됐어요 다섯 살부터였을 거예요

translation.en: I was in an art competition,
'cause I was kind of into art at that time,
and in the next room they had a spelling bee.
Since I was really young, they just let me in randomly.
translation.ko: 워낙 어렸을 때여서 그냥 해 보라는 취지였죠

translation.en: They didn’t really think I was gonna do any good or anything.
So they’re just like, “Yeah, sure, you can do it.”
translation.ko: '그래, 넌 할 수 있어' 이런 분위기였어요

translation.en: I go there, I take the tests, and I come third
translation.ko: 그래서 대회에 나갔는데 제가 3등을 한 거예요

translation.en: out of first-through-eighth graders.
And then my parents were just like...
"Something’s up." [chuckling]
[Swapna] My brother Bharat, he’s very focused
and he has set very high goals for himself.
So the same thing I observe in Ashrita.
Ashrita has a great influence on the younger kids
and also on the people way back in my hometown.
translation.ko: 이곳 사람들 모두에게 지대한 영향을 미쳐요

translation.en: As Ashrita was getting through each year,
trying to get through Scripps, people came to know that,
"Okay, this is what is happening."
During the competitions, we make sure that we are calling her every day,
because it’s not very easy to spell on the stage
translation.ko: 무대에서 철자를 외는 건 쉬운 일이 아니거든요

translation.en: where millions of people are watching her.
Whatever may be the result, we always love her and encourage her.
translation.ko: 결과가 어떻든 우리는 그 애를 사랑하고 응원해요

translation.en: -[woman singing Indian music over stereo] -[cymbal ringing]
[Tejas] The first time I thought "I want to win the Scripps Bee" was in fourth grade,
translation.ko: 처음으로 스크립스 비에서 이기고 싶었던 건 4학년 때였어요

translation.en: because I’d lost the county bee that year, placing second.
translation.ko: 당시 카운티 대회에서 2등으로 진 후로 계속해야 할 이유를 고민하던 차였죠

translation.en: And then I contemplated my reasons for continuing
because I was obviously crushed,
translation.ko: 계속해야 할 이유를 고민하던 차였죠 제 철저한 패배였거든요

translation.en: and then that same year I watched the National Spelling Bee,

translation.ko: 국내 최고의 스펠러를 찾는 경연에 출전할 수 있게 되죠

Capsule. May I have the definition?
The word is "gloaming."
That is correct.
That is correct. That's correct.
-[bell rings] -[male TV host] Wow, what a difficult Bee we have been fighting so far.
If my count is right, we’re down to just four spellers.
The word is "gamapetalous."
[boy] A-L...
That is correct.
That's correct.
That's correct. That's correct. That's correct. Correct.
[male pronouncer] The word is "bardiglio."
[male pronouncer] The word is "zwitterion."
[male pronouncer] The word is "promyshlennik."
Promyshlennik. Can I have the definition?
Can I have the language of origin?
Can I have the sentence?

-Can you repeat the word one more time? -Promyshlennik.

translation.en: That is correct.
[male TV host] Nicely done. Shourav, don’t go anywhere.
He has spelled the word correctly in his round.
There’s nobody else in his round to compete against,
so he goes on to a championship word. If he gets this correct,
translation.ko: 챔피언을 가릴 단어가 제시됩니다 이 제시어를 맞히면

translation.en: then he’s our champion. If not, the Bee continues.
Here we go.
The word is "rafraichissoir."
[male pronouncer] I guess he was pretty proud of that spelling!
I just won the Houston Public Media Regional Spelling Bee
translation.ko: 휴스턴 퍼블릭 미디어 스펠링 비 지역 대회에서 이겼어요

translation.en: and I’m feeling pretty good about it. [chuckles]
I just knew it off the top of my head and I...
I’m just like, why not just get it over with right then and there,
translation.ko: 바로 끝내는 게 좋을 것 같아서

translation.en: so I just spelled it, like, in two seconds flat.
We expected him to win, and he won in that sense, uh...
-It's a good turnout. -Yeah, it’s... It’s the expected outcome.
[Shourav] I’m just really happy and really proud, I guess,
just to be going back and representing Houston again.
translation.ko: 또다시 전국 대회에서 휴스턴을 대표할 수 있어서요

translation.en: I was talking with a past champion,
and of course I asked her the most obvious question,
translation.ko: 저도 뻔한 질문을 던졌죠 왜 그렇게 많은 인도계 미국인이 스펠링 비에서 이기는지요

translation.en: “Why do you think so many Indians win the Bees?”
translation.ko: 왜 그렇게 많은 인도계 미국인이 스펠링 비에서 이기는지요

translation.en: And she said, for her, one of the key reasons is that languages
translation.ko: 그분은 그러셨어요 여러 이유가 있겠지만 자신이나 자기 가족에게 언어는 아주 익숙한 분야라서 그렇다고요

translation.en: is something that her family and herself just know so much about.
translation.ko: 자신이나 자기 가족에게 언어는 아주 익숙한 분야라서 그렇다고요

translation.en: Her parents were fluent in five languages,
and while that’s a lot, being multilingual is commonplace.
translation.ko: 굉장한 일이지만 여러 언어 구사는 흔한 일이랬죠

translation.en: And the familiarity of language,
the ability to communicate so fluently across multiple languages,
translation.ko: 여러 언어로 유창하게 소통할 수 있는 능력은

translation.en: helps the kids in their minds grasp words,
grasp spelling, grasp languages, nuances, its etymologies,
translation.ko: 스펠링, 언어, 뉘앙스, 어원을 파악하는 데 도움이 됩니다

translation.en: and that helps them achieve in the Bee.
translation.ko: 더 나아가 스펠링 비에서 좋은 성적을 거두는 데도요

translation.en: [Krishna] Akash can fluently read-write three languages.
translation.ko: 아카슈는 3개 언어를 유창하게 읽고 쓸 수 있어요

translation.en: Mother tongue, English. Mother’s mother tongue, Telugu.
And then Hindi, which is India’s national language.
-So he’s fluent in three languages. Yeah. -Yeah, he can read and write.
translation.ko: - 그래서 3개 국어에 능통해요 - 네, 읽고 쓸 수 있습니다

translation.en: [Krishna] And he is really looking into learn other languages,
translation.ko: 아카슈는 다른 언어 학습에도 관심이 많아요

translation.en: like, you know, German or Hebrew or Korean.
translation.ko: 아카슈는 다른 언어 학습에도 관심이 많아요 독일어나 히브리어, 한국어요

translation.en: To be a winner, you probably need to master 60 to 100 thousand words.
You also need to understand patterns from different languages.
translation.ko: 다른 언어들의 패턴 또한 익혀야 하죠

translation.en: You need to study old Bees,
and one of the things we haven’t talked about
translation.ko: 한 가지 더 짚어야 할 점은

translation.en: is you’ve got to be able to stand on stage and think on your feet
and present these words without getting distracted
or getting flustered, and think through what the word means,
translation.ko: 허둥대지 않게 집중하면서요 단어 뜻을 생각하면서

translation.en: and you’ve got a limited time clock to do this. It’s a huge amount of work.
translation.ko: 시간제한까지 고려해야 하죠 신경 쓸 일이 굉장히 많아요

translation.en: Most of these students spend one to two hours a day, all week,
translation.ko: 참가 학생들은 대부분 매일 하루 한두 시간을 투자해요

translation.en: every week, and then more on the weekends,
translation.ko: 참가 학생들은 대부분 매일 하루 한두 시간을 투자해요 주말에는 더 많이 공부하죠

translation.en: and they do this for years leading up to the National Bee.
translation.ko: 전국 대회에 나오기까지 몇 년 동안 그렇게 고생해요

translation.en: Some of these students start on this
as young as three and four years old in some of these families.
translation.ko: 어떤 학생들은 서너 살 때부터 공부를 시작하기도 하죠

translation.en: These kids have put more time into spelling by the time they’re 13
translation.ko: 그런 아이들은 13세까지 스펠링에 엄청난 시간을 쏟아요

translation.en: than most of us put into anything our entire lives.
translation.ko: 대부분의 사람이 평생 뭔가에 투자하는 시간보다 많죠

translation.en: [Pawan Dhingra] The popular misconception of these families
translation.ko: 이런 가정에 대한 가장 큰 오해는

translation.en: is that they are "tiger parents,"
who are drilling their kids, forcing them to study against their will.
translation.ko: 애들은 원하지도 않는데 억지로 주입식 교육을 한다고요

translation.en: How else can you explain why so many Indian children
translation.ko: 이 틈새시장에서 그렇게나 많은 인도계 아이가

translation.en: are excelling in this one particular niche?
translation.ko: 뛰어난 성적을 거두는 건 다 그 때문이라고 보죠

translation.en: To be honest, when children are young,
parents do typically enroll their kids
translation.ko: 대개 부모가 참가 신청을 하긴 합니다

translation.en: in a spelling bee or some other academic competition,
the same way that parents enroll their children
into basketball or swimming without asking their kids' permission,
translation.ko: 그건 다른 대회도 마찬가지죠 농구나 수영 대회도 애들 허락 없이 부모가 등록해요

translation.en: hoping that their kids will like it and get good at something.
But the kids don’t stick with it unless they like it,
translation.ko: 하지만 흥미 없는 아이들은 금세 나가떨어지고 맙니다

translation.en: and the parents don’t force their kids to become spellers
translation.ko: 부모는 관심도 없는 아이를 스펠러가 되도록 강요하지 못해요

translation.en: unless the kids find some internal drive for it.
translation.ko: 부모는 관심도 없는 아이를 스펠러가 되도록 강요하지 못해요 아이 내면에서 우러나는 내적 동기가 있어야죠

translation.en: [Dr. Balu] The Spelling Bee was something I wanted to do.
translation.ko: 스펠링 비는 제가 하고 싶은 일이었어요

translation.en: I didn’t get intense pressure from home to do it.
In fact, after losing out in 1984 in the National Spelling Bee,
translation.ko: 사실 1984년 스펠링 비 전국 대회에서 진 후에는

translation.en: my parents said, “Do you really want to do this again?”
translation.ko: 정말 이걸 또 하고 싶으냐고 부모님이 물어보시기도 했어요

translation.en: I thought about it and I said, “Yes, I do want to pursue it again.”
translation.ko: 전 생각해 보고 답했죠 '네, 다시 한번 도전해 볼래요'

translation.en: [Dr. Sanjay] This is a metaphor for something else, a metaphor for success,
translation.ko: 이건 다른 무언가를 뜻해요 성공의 은유인 동시에

translation.en: it’s a metaphor for "I have achieved something
translation.ko: '내가 뭔가를 이뤘고' '공동체 내에서 인정받았다' 이런 의미이기도 하죠

translation.en: and received recognition within my own community,"
and the motivations would be the same as anything else in life.
translation.ko: 인생의 다른 것들도 그 동기는 다 비슷합니다

translation.en: Mmm! Let’s begin round one of the Vukoti Spelling Bee. Let's go.
Number one.
[Kevin Negandhi] When you watch the Bee,
the first thing you think of is
it’s a family affair throughout the whole process.
[Akash] Accommodate.
A-C-C-O-M-M-O-D-A-T-E.
-Accommodate. -[Krishna] Good job.
When a parent devotes a lot of time
to coaching a student through a spelling competition,
translation.ko: 아이를 코치하며 스펠링 대회를 준비할 때

translation.en: the siblings are there.
They’re listening to it, learning it, picking it up,
and there’s usually some competition among the siblings.
Their parents have already figured out by the time you get to the second sibling
how to help that speller learn and practice
in a much more refined and efficient way.
When the older one won the district spelling bee, the younger one,
translation.ko: 스펠링 비 학군 대회에서 큰아이가 이겼을 때

translation.en: who’s three years younger than him,
wrote down every word correctly in the district bee
translation.ko: 학군 대회에 나온 단어를 모조리 정확하게 썼어요

translation.en: that everybody got. So, you know, he’s...
He’s in second grade. [laughing]
[Shourav] I got into it in second grade,
and that was when Shobha was in fourth grade,
so we had just really started that year 'cause, like,
that was the year that Shobha won her first school spelling bee,
translation.ko: 그때 스펠링 비 학교 대회에서 쇼바가 처음으로 우승했거든요

translation.en: so then my parents just started helping her from there.
translation.ko: 그때 스펠링 비 학교 대회에서 쇼바가 처음으로 우승했거든요 부모님은 그때부터 누나를 돕기 시작했어요

translation.en: [Ganesh] Initially, we thought he would be a good pronouncer,
translation.ko: 처음에는 쇼라브가 잘 읽기만 하는 줄 알았어요

translation.en: because some of the words we were not able to pronounce the way Shobha wanted.
translation.ko: 쇼바가 요구하는 단어 중에 읽기 힘든 것들이 있어서

translation.en: So we recruited him as a pronouncer to Shobha,
and then he realized that, "Oh, I can just not be the pronouncer,
translation.ko: 그걸 좀 하더니 그냥 읽는 걸로는 부족하다면서

translation.en: I can be the best speller too and I can beat my sister too."
translation.ko: 자기도 스펠러가 될 수 있고 누나를 이길 수 있다고 하더군요

translation.en: So I think that’s how it started, and after that he took off.
[Shobha] We were really competitive with each other,
but it was kind of like a balance.
Like, we’d be really competitive at a bee and we wouldn’t talk to each other, that kind of thing.
translation.ko: 대회에서 치열하게 싸울 때는 서로 말도 안 걸었죠

translation.en: Or I would talk to him, but he wouldn’t talk to me.
translation.ko: 제가 말을 걸어도 동생이 대꾸를 안 했고요

translation.en: And then, once we got home, it was fine though.
We’d sit in the game room and play video games and, like...
that kind of thing.
I don’t think there was a moment
where he, like, questioned why he was doing it.
translation.ko: 동생이 의문을 품은 적은 없을 거예요

translation.en: He just knew he wanted to win, and so he, like... he just went for it,
translation.ko: 이기고 싶은 욕심이 있으니 최선을 다하는 것뿐이죠

translation.en: and I really admire that about him.
I’ve been doing it for such a long time,
and it’s something that I really enjoy.
And to be the best at it, that would be, like, a really surreal experience.
translation.ko: 이 일이 진심으로 즐거워요 이 분야 최고가 되는 건 정말 비현실적인 경험일 거예요

translation.en: Now, I’ll research more things about this.
I just like going to Wikipedia and reading about stuff 'cause I like reading.
translation.ko: 위키피디아 정독이 재미있어요 전 읽는 걸 좋아하거든요

translation.en: I can connect it to spelling in a way, because hali-ya, blah-blah-blah,
which is a scientific name for a bald eagle.
It actually comes from the Greek, hali meaning "sea," aetos meaning "eagle,"
leuko meaning "white," and suphlos meaning "head."
And they all squish it together.
So I just want to do further research into that.
If I see a new word, like in school, maybe...
Maybe one day, my teacher uses the word "finagle,"
I’m like, “What does finagle mean?” I look it up.
And maybe, in the word "finagle,’" I see the word "persifleur,’"
then maybe I’ll research that.
And then maybe in that entry, I find a different word.
translation.ko: 그러는 와중에 또 다른 단어를 발견하고

translation.en: And in that entry, I find a different word.
translation.ko: 또 그걸 찾다가 다른 단어를 발견해요

translation.en: And I research all of them, and then that’s how I expand my vocab.
translation.ko: 그걸 전부 다 찾아보면서 어휘력을 확장하죠

translation.en: [male] Akash, are you excited for tomorrow?
Yeah! I’m really excited! But I’m also kind of nervous at the same time.
translation.ko: 네, 너무 기대돼요 근데 긴장되기도 해요

translation.en: I want you to go through one more time all the etymology things, okay?
translation.ko: 어원 한 번 더 쭉 훑어보자

translation.en: -Yep. -You got the necessary words in this list.
Yeah, yeah, yeah. Okay, should we do it?
Long "iya" and a plural noun, spelled "ae,"
as in algae, larvae...
Wait, larvae?
Antennae.
So you know all these words' spellings, right? -[Akash] Mm-hmm. -Yes or no?
-[Chandrakala] So can I go to next page? -Go ahead.
-Cirrhosis. You wrote-- -[Akash] Cirrhosis. [Chandrakala] Mm-hmm.
-C-I... -[Chandrakala] Mm-hmm. ...R-R-H-O-S-I-S.
-Cirrhosis. -Good job!
If at all Akash continues his interest in the spellings
in the same way like what he has now,
we expect him to win the National Spelling Bee title,
translation.ko: 스펠링 비 전국 대회에서도 우승할 수 있을 거라고 봐요

translation.en: like, in three to four years, by sixth grade.
translation.ko: 3-4년 후에요 6학년이 되면 전국 챔피언이 될 수 있겠죠

translation.en: If he can become the national champion,
translation.ko: 6학년이 되면 전국 챔피언이 될 수 있겠죠

translation.en: he’ll be blessed and all of us would be blessed.
[female host] Contestants, if you will please rise.
We’re going to say the Pledge of Allegiance
translation.ko: 시작하기 전에 국기에 대한 맹세를 하죠

translation.en: before we get started.
[all] I pledge allegiance to the flag of the United States of America.
translation.ko: 나는 미합중국 국기에 충성을 다할 것을 맹세합니다

translation.en: [male] We all set? Let’s roll.
Stucco.
Is... Are there any other alternate pronunciations, please?
May I have the language of origin, please? May I have the definition, please?
translation.ko: 어느 언어에서 유래했나요? 무슨 뜻인지 알 수 있나요?

translation.en: May I have the sentence, please?
[male pronouncer] "Akash spent weeks finishing a large collage of a Paris street scene."
translation.ko: '아카슈는 몇 주를 투자해 파리 정경의 콜라주를 완성했다'

translation.en: [exaggerated deep voice] And then there were four. The final four.
This word has a homonym.
The word is "boarders."
It is a noun,
and it’s "people who are provided with regular meals
or regular meals and lodging."
translation.ko: 정기적인 식사나 숙식을 제공받는 사람들을 의미합니다

translation.en: May I have the alternate pronunciations, please?
[male] There are none.
May I have the language of origin, please?
[male] This word consists of two originally English parts.
Can you please repeat the word again?
translation.ko: 단어를 한 번 더 말씀해 주시겠어요?

translation.en: [male] Boarders.
Good luck to all my fellow spellers. I hope I’ll come back next year.
translation.ko: 남은 친구들에게 행운을 빌어요 내년에 다시 참가하고 싶네요

translation.en: [Amrita] He's still young and he has a lot of years,
translation.ko: 동생은 아직 어리고 앞으로 기회가 많아요

translation.en: so he might learn some new words.
translation.ko: 앞으로 새 단어를 배울 수 있겠죠

translation.en: I’ve heard of that word before,
but I’ve heard it many times when I was older.
'Cause when I was his age, I had no idea what that word is.
translation.ko: 저도 동생 나이 때는 무슨 단어인지 몰랐어요

translation.en: [Krishna] Akash, you're in second grade.
Yeah, you've got so many more chances to go.
-[Akash sobbing] -That's okay.
[Krishna] "The question over there was who would be going to Washington, D.C.,
translation.ko: 워싱턴 DC에 갈 사람을 가리는 대회일 뿐이라고 지역 대표를 뽑는 과정일 뿐이라고 말해 줬어요

translation.en: representing our region. That was the only question over there.
translation.ko: 지역 대표를 뽑는 과정일 뿐이라고 말해 줬어요

translation.en: You may or may not be the regional champion,
but you’re already the school champion,
and, you know, on the way to prepare for this Spelling Bee,
translation.ko: 넌 이미 학교 챔피언이라고 스펠링 비를 준비하는 동안

translation.en: you improved your knowledge. That’s the purpose
translation.ko: 배운 게 있으니 그거면 됐다고 스크립스 스펠링 비 전국 대회는 그래서 있는 거라고 했죠

translation.en: of why the Scripps National Spelling Bee is there,
translation.ko: 스크립스 스펠링 비 전국 대회는 그래서 있는 거라고 했죠

translation.en: and we are on the way.
One day, you may get the National Spelling Bee trophy."
translation.ko: 스펠링 비 전국 대회 트로피를 언젠가는 거머쥘 거라고요

translation.en: So that’s what we said. He understood it. You can see a smile on his face now.
translation.ko: 그렇게 말했더니 이해하더라고요 이제 아카슈는 미소를 되찾았어요

translation.en: [Krishna chuckling] That was only for, you know, a brief time,
and, you know, that’s very... quite natural for a kid.
If it isn't obvious yet, I love the Spelling Bee.
translation.ko: 아직 눈치 못 채셨나요? 전 스펠링 비 광팬입니다

translation.en: Or as I like to call it, the Indian Super Bowl.
translation.ko: 저는 스펠링 비를 인도판 슈퍼 볼이라 부르고 싶군요

translation.en: Six winners in a row! Six in a row, son!
-That’s incredible! -[audience laughing, cheering]
So it gives me great pleasure to finally say,
“Hey, white people, learn the language.”
Writing that piece, I got to put together all the reasons I loved it.
translation.ko: 스펠링 비를 좋아하는 이유를 대본을 쓰며 정리해 봤어요

translation.en: Like, here was something that we were dominant in...
translation.ko: 생각해 보니 그건 우리가 확실히 잘하는 분야더군요

translation.en: that had never been seen before.
And it's spelling!
But, of course,
the internet would not let me enjoy this completely.
One patriot tweeted,
“America has to step it up with our spelling game.
translation.ko: '미국은 우리의 스펠링 게임 실력을 키워야 한다'

translation.en: Last three remaining, all of Indian decent.”
First of all, these kids of Indian descent are also American.
translation.ko: 우선 이 인도계 후손 아이들은 전부 미국인입니다

translation.en: -[man] Woo! -Secondly, you spelled "descent" wrong!
The kid who won that year was Arvind Mahankali, who was from Queens.
translation.ko: "선생님 좀 보자!" 그해 우승자는 퀸스 출신의 아르빈드 마한칼리였어요

translation.en: It was a big deal to me,
both as a Queens resident and as an Indian-American.
translation.ko: 저한테는 더 크게 다가왔죠 저도 퀸스 주민이자 인도계 미국인이니까요

translation.en: These kids are amazing, and they know it!
translation.ko: 정말 대단한 애들이에요 자기들이 멋진 것도 알죠

translation.en: I mean, look how cool Arvind is winning the title.
translation.ko: 아르빈드가 우승 장면에서 얼마나 쿨한지 보세요

translation.en: That is so G! That is so G!
Little homie didn’t even care that he won!
He looks like he’s still waiting for the next word!
translation.ko: 아직 다음 단어를 기다리는 듯한 자세예요

translation.en: And I’m like, "Why can’t we celebrate that?
Why can’t we celebrate the fact
that this kid did something and he did it in such a cool way?"
translation.ko: 아이가 뭔가를 이뤘고 그 모습이 정말 쿨했다는 걸 다 같이 축하하고 싶었어요

translation.en: He reached the mountain top of that particular sport.
translation.ko: 그 스포츠 분야의 정상에 오른 셈이잖아요

translation.en: So, yeah, I wanted to celebrate that.
Luckily, I got to do that in a very ridiculous way.
translation.ko: 그걸 기념하고 싶었어요 다행스럽게도 아주 재미있게 풀 수 있었죠

translation.en: [Pawan Dhingra] For those of us who are not in the Bees, what we see online,
translation.ko: 온라인 매체를 통해 대회와 관련 없는 일반인들도 인도계 우승자에 대한 인종 차별 발언들을 접하게 됐어요

translation.en: the racist or xenophobic comments critiquing Indians who win,
translation.ko: 인도계 우승자에 대한 인종 차별 발언들을 접하게 됐어요 아주 폄훼적인 내용이라 무척 안타까웠죠

translation.en: it's very disparaging and it’s very disheartening.
And we worry about the families and, of course, about the kids themselves.
[Shalini Shankar] When you have an activity that's so explicitly branded
translation.ko: 철저하게 미국적인 행사라는 틀에 박힌 이미지를 가진 대회가 치러질 때

translation.en: as a quintessentially American contest,
translation.ko: 틀에 박힌 이미지를 가진 대회가 치러질 때

translation.en: the idea of who gets to be named as an American
and who is considered a legitimate champion in that arena
is really coded still by whiteness,
translation.ko: 아직도 백인 중심으로 따지는 사람들이 많습니다

translation.en: and there’s a real emphasis on America ultimately remaining a white country.
translation.ko: 궁극적으로 미국은 백인 국가여야 한다는 관점이죠

translation.en: I dread the day when "somebody else" wins the Spelling Bee,
translation.ko: '다른 누군가'가 스펠링 비에서 우승하는 날이 두려워요

translation.en: because it'll make me sad, the kind of commentary that comes out of that.
translation.ko: 그런 말이 나오면 슬플 것 같거든요

translation.en: And it’s the kind of commentary about taking something back that…
It is endemic to so much of our national debate right now
translation.ko: 전 국민이 나서서 말을 한마디씩 보태는데

translation.en: in such a misguided way.
For years, our representation was dictated by other people.
translation.ko: 수년 동안 우리의 이미지는 타인의 눈을 통해 창조됐어요

translation.en: We were forced to play convenience store owners
or we were forced to play cab drivers.
Like, there was a limited range of representation.
Like, film and TV, you know, especially when you’re such a small minority,
translation.ko: 우리를 바라보는 시선은 극히 제한적이었습니다 영화나 TV는 소수자에 큰 영향을 미쳐요

translation.en: affect how the whole country or the whole world views you.
translation.ko: 온 나라나 세상의 관점이 그로 인해 달라지거든요

translation.en: And these kids, like, they earn their way on television by succeeding.
translation.ko: 이 아이들은 스스로 일군 성공으로 TV에 모습을 드러냈어요

translation.en: Only in New York City could a child of Indian immigrants,
who speaks Spanish and Telugu,
translation.ko: 이 뉴욕 출신의 인도계 이민자 자녀는

translation.en: compete for a trophy
named for a British-American newspaper publisher,
and win the competition for spelling a Yiddish word.
translation.ko: 이디시어 단어의 스펠링을 맞혀 트로피를 거머쥐었습니다

translation.en: I’ve actually been kvelling all day.
Do you know how to spell "kvelling"? -Yeah, I figured. -[all laughing]
translation.ko: '크벨링' 철자를 아니? 그래, 그럴 줄 알았다

translation.en: That's correct. We have a champion!
Fatuous.
[male producer] Correct!
Zubrowka.
There you go!
[Tejas] This is my lucky purple rock.
His fifth grade teacher, Mrs. Gribben, she has given him that rock.
[Tejas] We keep it in here just to keep it really safe
because when I’m spelling, I don’t feel as confident
translation.ko: 스펠링을 할 때 이 돌이 없으면

translation.en: when I’m not carrying this rock.
So I always ensure that it’s safe and sound.
They’re treated like diamonds at my household where...
Especially during Bee season.
I know I might not really show it, but I’m just like…
translation.ko: 티는 많이 안 날지 몰라도 마치...

translation.en: I can’t describe it in words. I’m that excited!
translation.ko: 말로 표현 못 하겠어요 그 정도로 신나요

translation.en: A few years ago, when I was in first grade,
all I did was win my school and I participated in the regionals.
translation.ko: 학교 대회에서 이기고 지역 대회에 나갔는데

translation.en: Now, I’m actually going to the Scripps. I mean, that feeling is just great for me.
translation.ko: 이제 진짜 전국 대회라니 정말이지 기분 좋아요

translation.en: We have been waiting for this for the past two years.
Now it finally came true.
Oh, we heard so many exciting things about the Bee Week.
translation.ko: 대회가 치러지는 주에는 정말 재미난 일이 많대요

translation.en: Ah, we’re really excited to go and be there!
translation.ko: 얼마나 기대되는지 몰라요 어서 그 자리에 가고 싶어요

translation.en: Like, you know, my kid is going to be there on the ESPN,
so I can’t just like, yeah…
My goal? I’m studying really hard to be at least in the top 50,
translation.ko: 제 목표는 열심히 공부해서 적어도 50등 안에 드는 거예요

translation.en: but I’m not expecting to do better than that because I...
translation.ko: 그보다 높은 성적은 기대 안 해요 왜냐하면...

translation.en: I just really want to be in the top 50. That’s all I want to do this year.
translation.ko: 최종 50인에만 들고 싶어요 올해는 그게 제 목표예요

translation.ko: 스크립스 스펠링 비 전국 대회가 열흘 후에 열려요

Now, these ten days,

translation.ko: 사전 속 단어들을 한 번 더 살펴볼 거예요

translation.en: It’s kind of surreal, I guess,

You've only... I only have ten more days and then I’m done with it, so…
translation.ko: 고작 열흘 후면 모든 게 끝나잖아요

translation.en: It’s just kind of, like, just do all you can because...
translation.ko: 할 수 있는 건 다 해야 해요

translation.en: Well, in ten days, you’ll be done with it,
so you don’t have to worry about it anymore.
I just have, like, a few words here and there that I don’t know,
translation.ko: 잘 모르는 단어들이 곳곳에서 조금씩 나오지만

translation.en: so I think I’m pretty confident that whatever happens
then I’ll just be happy with it.
So these are diacritical marks, and that’s how, like,
translation.ko: 이건 발음 구별 기호예요 대회 진행자도 이 기호를 따라 출제 단어를 발음하죠

translation.en: the pronouncers at Bees read the words off the list that they have.
translation.ko: 대회 진행자도 이 기호를 따라 출제 단어를 발음하죠

translation.en: That’s how I also read the words for the database.
I just see the diacriticals and I can read it like a second language,

translation.en: and then I type it.
Usually, if it’s a word that I’m, like, 100 percent confident about,
I can, like... While I’m typing it, I can just look at the next word,
translation.ko: 타자를 치면서도 다음 단어를 볼 수 있어요

translation.en: so that’s how I can go so fast.
After, like, years of doing it, it just kind of becomes second nature.
translation.ko: 몇 년을 그렇게 하고 나면 아예 몸에 배요

translation.en: So, I’m about to just type and see how many words I can type in a minute
translation.ko: 이제 1분에 단어 몇 개를 입력할 수 있는지 보려고 해요

translation.en: if I just go as fast as I can, so…
-So, three, two, one. -[stopwatch beeps]
Yeah, so that’s…
I just finished the one minute and I did 45 words in that minute.
Saying it out loud takes, like, probably five to ten seconds.
Typing a word takes, like, two seconds... two to three seconds.
So it’s just... It just goes faster for the same effect,
translation.ko: 같은 효과를 내면서도 속도는 더 빠른 셈이에요

translation.en: so I think typing is, like, the better way.

translation.en: Now, it’s just up to the word I get and up to my stage performance."
It’s not exactly religious, but we follow a scripture
called Bhagavad Gita, where it says,

translation.ko: '네 몫을 하라 네 손을 떠난 일은 너무나 많으니'

translation.en: and don’t focus on the results."
And that’s something we have always been telling Tejas,

translation.en: not just for Spelling Bee, for his life.
translation.ko: 스펠링 비뿐만 아니라 인생을 그렇게 대하라고요

translation.en: I mean, for his studies, for his academics, for his job,

translation.en: The trend of Indian-American success in the Bee is long-running,
translation.ko: 인도계 미국인들은 스펠링 비에서 오랜 기간 좋은 성적을 내고 있죠

translation.en: and I think it’s going to continue in that direction

translation.en: for the unforeseeable future.
[male 2] Congratulations, Karthik.

translation.ko: 축하해, 카르틱, 네가 2018년 스펠링 비 전국 대회 챔피언이야! "2018년 스크립스 스펠링 비 전국 대회 챔피언"

translation.en: [male] The most phenomenal assemblage of super-spellers
translation.ko: 스펠링 비 역사상 가장 경이로운 슈퍼 스펠러들이

translation.en: in the history of this storied competition.
It’s never gonna be all Indian.
We have plenty of other students who are competing,
but they are highly successful, they are having fun with it,
translation.ko: 하지만 인도계 학생들은 훌륭한 성적을 내며 즐기고 있어요

translation.en: and they are winning. I don’t see it changing anytime soon.
translation.ko: 우승도 차지하고요 금세 바뀌지는 않을 겁니다

translation.en: The only way Indian-American kids are losing the Spelling Bee
translation.ko: 인도계 미국인 아이들을 스펠링 비에서 지게 하려면

translation.en: is if they switch to Spanish next year.
translation.ko: 내년부터 종목을 스페인어로 바꾸는 수밖에 없어요

translation.en: And then it’s still, like, 50/50.
I think that this is in part a reflection of this particular time in our history,
translation.ko: 저는 스펠링 비가 우리 역사의 이 특정한 시대를 반영한다고 봐요

translation.en: and some of the values that have been instilled, I think,
by Indian immigrants on their kids.
translation.ko: 자녀들에게 주입한 다양한 가치 중 일부죠

translation.en: The relentless and, I think, you know, for the most part, constructive focus
on education for these kids,
and the fact that spelling in particular ended up fulfilling all these aspirations
translation.ko: 특히 스펠링은 자녀에 대한 부모의 열망을

translation.en: of these parents for their kids.
[Dr. Sanjay Gupta] As generations go on,
translation.ko: 하지만 세대가 지날수록 스펠링 비 같은 대회에

translation.en: you may see less of a focus on things like Spelling Bees
translation.ko: 하지만 세대가 지날수록 스펠링 비 같은 대회에 집중하는 현상은 줄 겁니다

translation.en: and hopefully more of a focus on other areas as well.
translation.ko: 전 아이들이 다른 분야에도 관심을 쏟았으면 해요

translation.en: Things that may not necessarily be purely academic,
but other areas where kids are interested in and want to excel.
translation.ko: 아이들이 흥미를 갖고 욕심내는 일이 있으면 좋죠

translation.en: So I think you’ll see a sort of more broadening out
of particularly Indian-American kids’ interests.
[Hari Kondabolu] The Spelling Bee playing every year on television,
I think it certainly inspires lots of South Asian kids, Indian-American kids
translation.ko: 그걸 본 남아시아계, 인도계 미국인 아이들이 자극을 받고

translation.en: to take up spelling as a thing.
But it’s also getting a bunch of other kids into it too
that aren’t South Asian.
Tiger Woods, most of his heroes in golf would’ve been white, right?
translation.ko: 타이거 우즈가 존경한 골프 영웅들은 백인이었겠죠?

translation.en: Like, for the most part? Like, considering what the sport is?
translation.ko: 대부분 그렇지 않았을까요? 스포츠 특성을 생각해 보면요

translation.en: Yet that inspired him to achieve,
so who’s to say that there isn’t some, like, kid in the middle of America,
translation.ko: 그러니 누가 단언하겠어요? 미국 중부 출신의 아이든

translation.en: who’s, like, brown or black or Latino,
isn’t a huge Arvind Mahankali-head.
translation.ko: 다 아르빈드 마한칼리처럼 될 수 있는 거죠

translation.en: That’s, like, the dude he looked up to when he was a kid,
and now wants to win.
[Fareed] But the truth is, I think, what these kids show more than anything else
translation.ko: "2019년 스펠링 비 우승자 8명 중 6명이 그의 회사를 이용했다" 하지만 사실 그 무엇보다 이 아이들이 보여 주는 것은

translation.en: is American assimilation at work.
Here are kids who really come from a very different world and culture
translation.ko: 이 아이들은 미국과는 아주 다른 세상에서 왔죠

translation.en: in their historical and cultural origins,
and they are taking part in the most American tradition,
doing well at it, playing by the rules.
translation.ko: 규정에 따르며 훌륭한 성적을 내고 있어요

translation.en: If that’s not American assimilation at work, I don’t know what is.
[Kevin Negandhi] We are part of this DNA, this melting pot, uh, cliché.
translation.ko: 진부하긴 하지만 우리는 이 용광로 DNA의 일부예요

translation.en: And it’s not a cliché, we are part of it.
translation.ko: 그저 뻔한 표현이 아니라 우리는 진짜 그 일부입니다

translation.en: And to have ownership of one thing,
in the sense of that we can dominate something, it’s pretty cool,
considering there’s just one percent of the population of Indian-Americans.
translation.ko: 전체 인구 중 1%에 불과한 인도계 미국인에게는 멋진 일이죠

translation.en: So to me, when I say that, I say that as a joke, like,
"Yes! We own this!"
Because it’s a small thing,
but it means so much to so many people in our community.
translation.ko: 우리 공동체 사람들에게는 정말이지 큰 의미거든요

translation.en: [Dr. Gupta] It just was the perfect storm. And I think Spelling Bees,
translation.ko: 모든 게 잘 맞아떨어졌어요 이제 인도계 미국인에게 스펠링 비는 올림픽급 행사가 됐죠

translation.en: I mean, that became the Olympics for so many Indians.
translation.ko: 이제 인도계 미국인에게 스펠링 비는 올림픽급 행사가 됐죠

translation.en: I just need to say it slowly.
[Krishna] You got it.
Humu humu, you just say "humu humu," and then you say "nuku nuku,"
translation.ko: 후무 후무, '후무 후무' 하고 그다음에 '누쿠 누쿠'

translation.en: and then you say "apua ah," and then you finish the whole thing.
[Krishna] Say it.
